message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about a multilingual Named Entity Recognition (NER) system that leverages external knowledge. The paper discusses a novel modular framework that divides knowledge into four categories according to the depth of knowledge they convey. The paper also discusses the use of different information sources such as a knowledge-base, a list of names or document-specific semantic annotations. These features are used to train a conditional random field (CRF). The paper discusses the incorporation of deeper knowledge systematically boosts accuracy and compares KnowNER with state-of-the-art NER approaches across three languages (i.e., English, German and Spanish). Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
